alert.note: Alert for Bullitt; Jefferson; Oldham (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:43PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jefferson and Bullitt Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Minor Lane Heights to 6 miles south of Shepherdsville. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lynnview, South Park View, Okolona, Newburg and Fairdale around 150 PM EDT. Louisville, Audubon Park, Watterson Park, Hollow Creek, Parkway Village, Poplar Hills, Spring Mill and Highview around 155 PM EDT. West Buechel, Seneca Gardens, Strathmoor Village, Kingsley, Strathmoor Manor, Buechel and Fern Creek around 200 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hurstbourne Acres, St. Regis Park, Woodlawn Park, Rolling Fields, Houston Acres, Norbourne Estates, Richlawn, Meadowview Estates, Bellewood, Brownsboro Village, Jeffersontown, St. Matthews, Douglass Hills, Hurstbourne, Graymoor-Devondale, Windy Hills, Pioneer Village, Beechwood Village, Northfield, Bellemeade, Lyndon, Anchorage, Barbourmeade, Rolling Hills, Langdon Place, Plantation, Meadow Vale, Green Spring, Woodland Hills, Spring Valley, Middletown, Prospect, Worthington Hills and Coldstream. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
